TopicTitle: KSP doesn't see axis on my flight stick

Articles.Content:
I have a Defender Cobra M5 stick, and while KSP correctly identifies pitch and roll, yaw and throttle axes are not detected when I try to set them up.

They work fine in the Windows' calibration tool though. Anybody can help me set it up?

Sorry Queril, probably not, there is a known issue with controllers failing to be detected correctly and settings failing to persist, I'm pushing to get this fixed for 1.0.5

All I can suggest is that you ensure the stick is plugged in before starting KSP, try restarting KSP with it plugged in and don't start KSP without the stick if any axis or buttons are bound.

Thanks, hope it will get fixed soon.

The stick is plugged in all the time, so I'm sure there's no problem there.
Same thing. Stick is working on the Elite Dangerous, but KSP can't see the axes, it can see just the buttons. Please push it! =)
Same. Cobra M5 in KSP: twist (yaw) axis is not recognized and could not be mapped.
